name: StatusEffectHelper
description: The StatusEffectHelper class provides a wrapper around Minecraft's status effect instances (potions and effects), allowing scripts to query information about active status effects on entities.
overview:
The `StatusEffectHelper` class provides a wrapper around Minecraft's status effect instances (potions and effects), allowing scripts to query information about active status effects on entities. Status effects include beneficial effects like Speed and Strength, harmful effects like Poison and Wither, and neutral effects like Night Vision.

This helper class provides methods to access all key properties of status effects including their type identifier, amplifier level, remaining duration, visual properties, and categorization. It's commonly used when examining player status effects, monitoring entity effects during combat, or tracking potion effects in automation scripts.

constructors.description: Internal constructor that wraps a Minecraft status effect instance.

parameters.name: statusEffectInstance
parameters.description: The underlying Minecraft status effect instance to wrap

methods.name: getId
methods.description: Gets the identifier of the status effect (e.g., 'minecraft:speed').

methods.name: getStrength
methods.description: Gets the amplifier level of the status effect. Note that this is 0-based (e.g., Strength I is 0, Strength II is 1).
examples: const level = strength + 1; // Convert to in-game level

methods.name: getTime
methods.description: Gets the remaining duration of the effect in ticks (20 ticks = 1 second).

methods.name: getCategory
methods.description: Gets the category of the status effect (BENEFICIAL, HARMFUL, or NEUTRAL).

methods.name: isAmbient
methods.description: Checks if the effect is ambient, usually originating from a beacon or conduit.

methods.name: hasIcon
methods.description: Checks if the status effect has a HUD icon.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.description: Checks if the effect produces visible particles.

methods.name: isInstant
methods.description: Checks if the effect is instant (e.g., Instant Health, Instant Damage).

methods.name: isBeneficial
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is categorized as beneficial.

methods.name: isNeutral
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is categorized as neutral.

methods.name: isHarmful
methods.description: Checks if the status effect is categorized as harmful.

methods.name: isPermanent
methods.description: Checks if the effect is considered permanent (infinite duration).
